title: VW CEO Apologizes For Breaking Public Trust
text:
Get Business &Technology Alerts 
21 Sep 2015 01:36 AM EST 
Volkswagen CEO said today the company has ordered an external investigation after US regulators found that software the carmaker designed for diesel cars gave false emissions data. He added he was “deeply sorry” for the violation of US rules.Martin Winterkorn said in a statement published by the carmaker on Sunday, “I personally am deeply sorry that we have broken the trust of our customers and the public. Volkswagen has ordered an external investigation of this matter.”The US Environmental Protection Agency said on Friday the software deceived regulators measuring toxic emissions, adding that Volkswagen could face fines of up to $18bn as a result.
